document.heading: Uniform Real Property Electronic Recording Act of 2005

history.narrative: Law 16-25, the “Uniform Real Property Electronic Recording Act of 2005”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-173 which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 7, 2005, and July 6, 2005, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 14, 2005, it was assigned Act No. 16-134 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-25 became effective on October 18, 2005.
